name: Lagoa da Messejana
description: An iconic lagoon with over 33 hectares of water and the largest statue of Iracema, standing over 12 meters tall.
address: Av. Frei Cirilo, Messejana, Fortaleza - CE, 60840-005, Brazil

name: Centro das Tapioqueiras
description: A traditional gastronomic hub with numerous stalls offering Ceará-style tapioca and local handicrafts.
address: Av. Washington Soares, 9900 - Messejana, Fortaleza - CE, 60871-901, Brazil

name: Messejana Street Market
description: A historic open-air market operating for over 300 years, offering food, clothing, and crafts, especially busy on weekends.
address: Praça da Igreja Matriz, Messejana, Fortaleza - CE, 60840-005, Brazil

name: Church of Our Lady of Conception
description: A historical and religious landmark built on the site of the first Jesuit chapel from the 17th century.
address: Praça da Igreja Matriz, Messejana, Fortaleza - CE, 60840-005, Brazil

name: House of José de Alencar
description: The birthplace of the famous Brazilian writer José de Alencar, now functioning as a museum.
address: Av. Washington Soares, 6055 - José de Alencar, Fortaleza - CE, 60830-471, Brazil

name: Messejana Hospital
description: A healthcare reference center founded in 1930, specializing in cardiology and pulmonology.
address: Av. Frei Cirilo, 3480 - Messejana, Fortaleza - CE, 60840-005, Brazil

name: Messejana Bus Terminal
description: A major public transportation hub in Fortaleza, serving around 135,000 passengers daily.
address: Av. Jornalista Tomás Coelho, Messejana, Fortaleza - CE, 60840-005, Brazil

name: Messejana Public Market
description: A 19th-century colonial-style market and key commercial center, known for its vibrant Sunday market.
address: Praça da Igreja Matriz, Messejana, Fortaleza - CE, 60840-005, Brazil
